passage:
(1) Agricultural landscapes represent the most widespread human-modified environments on Earth, covering approximately 38% of the planet's ice-free land surface. These landscapes are not merely sites of food production but complex socio-ecological systems that have evolved over centuries through the interaction between human activities and natural processes. The specific ways in which farmers manage their land—from crop selection and rotation patterns to irrigation methods and pest management—profoundly influence not only agricultural productivity but also the surrounding ecosystem's health, biodiversity, and resilience to environmental changes.

(2) Conventional farming practices that emerged during the 20th century's Green Revolution dramatically increased crop yields through mechanization, synthetic fertilizers, and pesticides, effectively feeding growing populations worldwide. However, these high-input systems often come with significant ecological trade-offs, including soil degradation, water pollution, habitat destruction, and greenhouse gas emissions. In many regions, decades of intensive cultivation have resulted in depleted soils, reduced biodiversity, and compromised watershed functions, raising questions about the long-term sustainability of such approaches.

(3) In response to these challenges, alternative agricultural paradigms have gained traction globally. Organic farming, agroforestry, conservation agriculture, and permaculture represent different approaches that generally aim to work more harmoniously with natural processes rather than attempting to override them. These methods typically incorporate practices such as reduced tillage, cover cropping, integrated pest management, and diversified planting schemes. Research increasingly suggests that well-managed sustainable farming systems can maintain competitive yields while significantly reducing negative environmental impacts and in some cases actively regenerating ecosystem functions.

(4) Beyond the field level, agricultural landscapes form mosaics that influence regional environmental conditions in profound ways. The arrangement of farms, hedgerows, woodlots, and waterways creates ecological corridors and habitat patches that can either support or impede biodiversity. Farming practices affect hydrological cycles through irrigation demands, drainage patterns, and impacts on water quality. Additionally, agricultural decisions influence climate at both local and global scales through effects on albedo, evapotranspiration, carbon sequestration, and greenhouse gas emissions. The cumulative impact of thousands of farm-level decisions ultimately shapes the environmental character of entire regions.

(5) Looking forward, the challenge lies in developing agricultural systems that can meet growing food demands while simultaneously preserving the ecological foundations upon which farming depends. This will require integrating traditional knowledge with modern scientific understanding, adapting practices to specific local conditions, and creating policy frameworks that reward farmers for providing ecosystem services beyond food production. The future of agricultural landscapes will be determined by our collective capacity to balance immediate production needs with long-term environmental stewardship, recognizing that healthy ecosystems are not luxury amenities but fundamental prerequisites for sustainable food systems.

questions.question: Select the grammatically correct sentence:

options.A: Each of the students have their own laptop for the course.
options.B: Either John or his brothers is going to help with the project.
options.C: Neither of the candidates has withdrawn from the race.
options.D: The data shows that there are less people attending than last year.

questions.question: Choose the sentence with the correct use of articles:

options.A: She is studying at an university in the northern part of country.
options.B: He gave me useful advice about the life in foreign country.
options.C: We saw an interesting documentary about the history of aviation.
options.D: There was the accident on highway this morning.

questions.question: Identify the sentence with the correct use of verb tenses:

options.A: By the time the professor arrived, the lecture already started.
options.B: She lives in this city since 2010.
options.C: After she had finished her exam, she went out for lunch.
options.D: I will completed the assignment by tomorrow morning.

questions.question: Which sentence contains a misplaced modifier?

options.A: Exhausted after the long hike, the cabin was a welcome sight for the hikers.
options.B: The professor explained the complex theory to the students clearly.
options.C: Having studied all night, the exam seemed easy to Sarah.
options.D: Walking through the garden, I noticed several butterflies on the flowers.

questions.question: Select the sentence with the correct use of comparatives and superlatives:

options.A: This is the most unique example I have ever seen.
options.B: His presentation was more clearer than the previous speaker's.
options.C: That was the most interesting of the three lectures we attended.
options.D: She is the more intelligent than her cousin.

questions.question: Choose the sentence with correct subject-verb agreement:

options.A: The committee are divided on this issue.
options.B: Neither the teacher nor the students was prepared for the drill.
options.C: A variety of options is available to customers.
options.D: Mathematics are my favorite subject in school.

questions.question: Identify the sentence that uses the passive voice correctly:

options.A: The book was writing by a famous author.
options.B: The exhibition has been visited by thousands of people this month.
options.C: The project will completing by the team next week.
options.D: A mistake has made in the calculations.

questions.question: Which sentence demonstrates correct use of a relative clause?

options.A: The woman who house was damaged in the storm has filed a claim.
options.B: The restaurant which we had dinner last night was excellent.
options.C: The professor whose class I'm taking this semester is an expert in quantum physics.
options.D: The city where I visited last summer has beautiful architecture.

questions.question: Select the sentence with the correct conditional form:

options.A: If I would have known about the meeting, I would have attended.
options.B: If they arrived earlier, they would have seen the opening ceremony.
options.C: If it rains tomorrow, we would cancel the picnic.
options.D: If I had been in your position, I will make the same decision.

questions.question: Choose the sentence that uses modal verbs correctly:

options.A: You must to submit your application before the deadline.
options.B: She can singing very well in three different languages.
options.C: They might not have received our message yet.
options.D: He should studying more if he wants to pass the exam.

questions.question: Identify the sentence with correct parallel structure:

options.A: The company focuses on developing new products, improving customer service, and to increase market share.
options.B: She enjoys swimming, hiking, and to play tennis on weekends.
options.C: The report examines the causes of the problem, analyzes potential solutions, and recommends specific actions.
options.D: He not only finished the assignment on time but also he got an excellent grade.

questions.question: Select the sentence with the correct use of gerunds and infinitives:

options.A: She avoided to talk about her experience during the interview.
options.B: They discussed to implement the new policy next month.
options.C: He admitted stealing the confidential documents.
options.D: I look forward to met you at the conference.

questions.question: Choose the sentence with the correct use of reported speech:

options.A: She said that she has finished the project yesterday.
options.B: He told me that he will arrive the next day.
options.C: They asked if I can help them with the preparations.
options.D: The teacher announced that the exam would be postponed.

questions.question: Which sentence uses prepositions correctly?

options.A: We arrived to London on Monday morning.
options.B: She has been working in this company since five years.
options.C: The book is divided into three main sections.
options.D: He is interested about ancient history and archaeology.

questions.question: Select the sentence with correct punctuation:

options.A: After considering all the options they decided to postpone the meeting.
options.B: The museum which opened last year, has attracted many visitors.
options.C: Despite the rain, they continued with their outdoor activities.
options.D: My colleague John who works in marketing suggested a new approach.

options.B: Based on or in accordance with general agreement, custom, or tradition
options.C: Relating to a formal written agreement

questions.question: According to paragraph 1, what percentage of the Earth's ice-free land surface is covered by agricultural landscapes?
Which of the following is NOT mentioned in paragraph 2 as an ecological trade-off of conventional farming practices?

options.B: Water pollution
options.C: Increased labor costs

questions.question: According to paragraph 3, which of the following is a characteristic of alternative agricultural paradigms?

options.A: They prioritize maximum yield over all other considerations
options.B: They attempt to override natural processes
options.C: They typically incorporate reduced tillage
options.D: They have consistently lower yields than conventional methods

questions.question: Based on paragraph 4, how do agricultural landscapes affect regional environmental conditions?

options.A: They have minimal impact on biodiversity
options.B: They create ecological corridors that can support biodiversity
options.C: They always impede biodiversity regardless of management
options.D: They affect only local climate patterns but not global ones

questions.question: What does the author suggest is necessary for developing sustainable agricultural systems in the future?

options.B: Focusing exclusively on food production efficiency
options.C: Integrating traditional knowledge with modern scientific understanding

questions.question: The main purpose of this passage is to:

options.B: Explain how agricultural practices shape regional environments
options.C: Promote specific alternative farming methods

questions.question: The author's tone in discussing agricultural landscapes could best be described as:

options.B: Neutral and analytical
options.C: Enthusiastic and promotional

questions.question: According to the passage, agricultural decisions influence climate through all of the following EXCEPT:

options.B: Carbon sequestration
options.C: Ozone depletion

questions.question: In the context of the passage, what does the author mean by 'ecosystem services' in paragraph 5?

options.B: Environmental benefits beyond food production
options.C: Government agricultural subsidies

questions.question: Based on the passage, which statement best reflects the author's view on healthy ecosystems?

options.A: They are unnecessary for modern agricultural systems
options.B: They are luxury amenities that farmers cannot afford to maintain
options.C: They are fundamental prerequisites for sustainable food systems
options.D: They are relevant only for organic and alternative farming methods
